NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Postcards, greeting cards and other printed matter
Paper or paperboard registers, account books, binders, forms and other articles of printed stationery

CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01B02

TI_TEXT.P: Печатни материали и свързани с тях продукти
Tiskano gradivo in z njim povezani izdelki

SHORT_DESCR.P: The NWUPC is seeking to establish a multi-provider Framework Agreement for Print Solutions on behalf of the members of;
NWUPC http://www.nwupc.ac.uk/members/index.php
HEPCW http://www.hepcw.ac.uk/about-us-2/
LUPC http://lupc.ac.uk/list-of-members.html
NEUPC http://www.neupc.ac.uk/our-members
SUPC http://supc.procureweb.ac.uk/about-us
The Framework Agreement will be split into eleven (11) lots as follows:
1 — Print Solutions — North West England
2 — Print Solutions — North East England, including Yorkshire
3 — Print Solutions — East Midlands
4 — Print Solutions — Wales
5 — Print Solutions — West Midlands
6 — Print Solutions — East of England
7 — Print Solutions — Greater London
8 — Print Solutions — South East England
9 — Print Solutions — South West England
10 — Print Solutions — Northern Ireland
11 — Print Management Services — Neutral Vendor
Please see complementary info for other bodies this Framework is open to. Please refer to Tender Document for full details and instructions.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: Tenderers can apply for multiple lots within Lots 1 — 10. However if you apply for any of the Lots 1 — 10 you cannot also apply for Lot 11. If Tenderers apply for Lot 11 they cannot apply for any other Lot.

TITLE.P: Lot 1 — Print Solutions — North West England

SHORT_DESCR.P: The NWUPC is seeking to establish a multi-provider Framework Agreement on behalf of the members of NWUPC, HEPCW, LUPC, NEUPC and SUPC for Print Solutions.

This Framework Agreement will commence on 1.5.2018 for an initial period of twenty four (24) months until 30.4.2020 with the option to extend the Agreement for twelve (12) months until 30.4.2021 and a further twelve (12) months until 30.4.2022 subject to satisfactory Economic Operator performance.
1.3.5 The Framework Agreement will be split into eleven (11) lots as follows:
Lot 1 — Print Solutions — North West England
Lot 2 — Print Solutions — North East England, including Yorkshire
Lot 3 — Print Solutions — East Midlands
Lot 4 — Print Solutions — Wales
Lot 5 — Print Solutions — West Midlands
Lot 6 — Print Solutions — East of England
Lot 7 — Print Solutions — Greater London
Lot 8 — Print Solutions — South East England
Lot 9 — Print Solutions — South West England
Lot 10 — Print Solutions — Northern Ireland
Lot 11 — Print Management Services — Neutral Vendor.

It is intended that a maximum of 6 suppliers will be appointed to each lot. These will be the Tenderers who meet the minimum total weighting requirements and score the highest based on the Award Criteria. If a number of suppliers score equally and fall into joint 6th place then all tenderers in equal 6th place will be awarded a place on the Framework Agreement.

Lots 1 — 10 Print Solutions includes, but is not limited to, the following scope; printing, binding, copying, laminating, lithographic printing, digital printing, wide format printing, prospectus printing, leaflets, booklets, business stationery, postcards, booklets, calendars, labels, banners, posters, binders, wallets, folders, finishing. The scope also includes the provision of all elements of design work, web2print functionality and the fulfilment and distribution of the in scope goods. This list is not exhaustive.

Lot 11 Print Management Services — Neutral Vendor includes, to obtain the best value service for members by the appointment and management of suppliers capable of providing the services to meet the following scope; printing, binding, copying, laminating, lithographic printing, digital printing, wide format printing, prospectus printing, leaflets, booklets, business stationery, postcards, booklets, calendars, labels, banners, posters, binders, wallets, folders, finishing. The scope also includes the provision of all elements of design work, web2print functionality and the fulfilment and distribution of the in scope goods. This list is not exhaustive.
The following organisations have committed to this procurement and intend to utilise the Framework Agreement as soon as possible after award:
NWUPC http://www.nwupc.ac.uk/members/index.php
HEPCW http://www.hepcw.ac.uk/about-us-2/
LUPC http://www.lupc.ac.uk/list-of-members.html
NEUPC http://www.neupc.ac.uk/our-members
SUPC http://supc.procureweb.ac.uk/about-us

The Framework Agreement is open to the current Member Institutions & affiliated Public Sector Bodies including FE colleges and the Research Councils (http://www.rcuk.ac.uk/) as defined by the above Consortia. Links to the membership of each Consortium are provided in 1.4.1 of the ITT.
Please refer to the Tender Document for full details and instructions.

INFO_ADD.P: The procurement is related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds: yes.

Identification of the project: Call offs by Members from the resulting Framework may be conducted by institutions using various funds including but not limited to the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF).

TITLE.P: Lot 2 - Print Solutions - North East England, including Yorkshire

SHORT_DESCR.P: The NWUPC is seeking to establish a multi-provider Framework Agreement on behalf of the members of NWUPC, HEPCW, LUPC, NEUPC and SUPC for Print Solutions.

This Framework Agreement will commence on 1st May 2018 for an initial period of twenty four (24) months until 30th April 2020 with the option to extend the Agreement for twelve (12) months until 30th April 2021 and a further twelve (12) months until 30th April 2022 subject to satisfactory Economic Operator performance.
1.3.5 The Framework Agreement will be split into eleven (11) lots as follows:
Lot 1 – Print Solutions – North West England.
Lot 2 – Print Solutions – North East England, including Yorkshire.
Lot 3 – Print Solutions – East Midlands.
Lot 4 – Print Solutions – Wales.
Lot 5 – Print Solutions – West Midlands.
Lot 6 – Print Solutions – East of England.
Lot 7 – Print Solutions – Greater London.
Lot 8 – Print Solutions – South East England.
Lot 9 – Print Solutions – South West England.
Lot 10 – Print Solutions – Northern Ireland.
Lot 11 - Print Management Services – Neutral Vendor.

It is intended that a maximum of six suppliers will be appointed to each lot. These will be the Tenderers who meet the minimum total weighting requirements and score the highest based on the Award Criteria. If a number of suppliers score equally and fall into joint sixth place then all tenderers in equal sixth place will be awarded a place on the Framework Agreement.

Lots 1-10 Print Solutions includes, but is not limited to, the following scope; printing, binding, copying, laminating, lithographic printing, digital printing, wide format printing, prospectus printing, leaflets, booklets, business stationery, postcards, booklets, calendars, labels, banners, posters, binders, wallets, folders, finishing. The scope also includes the provision of all elements of design work, web2print functionality and the fulfilment and distribution of the in scope goods. This list is not exhaustive.

Lot 11 Print Management Services – Neutral Vendor includes, to obtain the best value service for members by the appointment and management of suppliers capable of providing the services to meet the following scope; printing, binding, copying, laminating, lithographic printing, digital printing, wide format printing, prospectus printing, leaflets, booklets, business stationery, postcards, booklets, calendars, labels, banners, posters, binders, wallets, folders, finishing. The scope also includes the provision of all elements of design work, web2print functionality and the fulfilment and distribution of the in scope goods. This list is not exhaustive.
The following organisations have committed to this procurement and intend to utilise the Framework Agreement as soon as possible after award:
NWUPC http://www.nwupc.ac.uk/members/index.php.
HEPCW http://www.hepcw.ac.uk/about-us-2/.
LUPC http://www.lupc.ac.uk/list-of-members.html.
NEUPC http://www.neupc.ac.uk/our-members.
SUPC http://supc.procureweb.ac.uk/about-us.

The Framework Agreement is open to the current Member Institutions & affiliated Public Sector Bodies including FE colleges and the Research Councils (http://www.rcuk.ac.uk/) as defined by the above Consortia. Links to the membership of each Consortium are provided in 1.4.1 of the ITT.
Please refer to the Tender Document for full details and instructions.

INFO_ADD.P: The procurement is related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds: yes.

Identification of the project: Call offs by Members from the resulting Framework may be conducted by institutions using various funds including but not limited to the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF).

Lots 1-10 Print Solutions includes, but is not limited to, the following scope; printing, binding, copying, laminating, lithographic printing, digital printing, wide format printing, prospectus printing, leaflets, booklets, business stationery, postcards, booklets, calendars, labels, banners, posters, binders, wallets, folders, finishing. The scope also includes the provision of all elements of design work, web2print functionality and the fulfilment and distribution of the in scope goods. This list is not exhaustive.

Lot 11 Print Management Services – Neutral Vendor includes, to obtain the best value service for members by the appointment and management of suppliers capable of providing the services to meet the following scope; printing, binding, copying, laminating, lithographic printing, digital printing, wide format printing, prospectus printing, leaflets, booklets, business stationery, postcards, booklets, calendars, labels, banners, posters, binders, wallets, folders, finishing. The scope also includes the provision of all elements of design work, web2print functionality and the fulfilment and distribution of the in scope goods. This list is not exhaustive.
The following organisations have committed to this procurement and intend to utilise the Framework Agreement as soon as possible after award:
NWUPC http://www.nwupc.ac.uk/members/index.php.
HEPCW http://www.hepcw.ac.uk/about-us-2/.
LUPC http://www.lupc.ac.uk/list-of-members.html.
NEUPC http://www.neupc.ac.uk/our-members.
SUPC http://supc.procureweb.ac.uk/about-us.

The Framework Agreement is open to the current Member Institutions & affiliated Public Sector Bodies including FE colleges and the Research Councils (http://www.rcuk.ac.uk/) as defined by the above Consortia. Links to the membership of each Consortium are provided in 1.4.1 of the ITT.
Please refer to the Tender Document for full details and instructions.

INFO_ADD.P: The procurement is related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds: yes.

Identification of the project: Call offs by Members from the resulting Framework may be conducted by institutions using various funds including but not limited to the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF).

SHORT_DESCR.P: The NWUPC is seeking to establish a multi-provider Framework Agreement on behalf of the members of NWUPC, HEPCW, LUPC, NEUPC and SUPC for Print Solutions.

This Framework Agreement will commence on 1st May 2018 for an initial period of twenty four (24) months until 30th April 2020 with the option to extend the Agreement for twelve (12) months until 30th April 2021 and a further twelve (12) months until 30th April 2022 subject to satisfactory Economic Operator performance.
1.3.5 The Framework Agreement will be split into eleven (11) lots as follows:
Lot 1 – Print Solutions – North West England.
Lot 2 – Print Solutions – North East England, including Yorkshire.
Lot 3 – Print Solutions – East Midlands.
Lot 4 – Print Solutions – Wales.
Lot 5 – Print Solutions – West Midlands.
Lot 6 – Print Solutions – East of England.
Lot 7 – Print Solutions – Greater London.
Lot 8 – Print Solutions – South East England.
Lot 9 – Print Solutions – South West England.
Lot 10 – Print Solutions – Northern Ireland.
Lot 11 - Print Management Services – Neutral Vendor.

It is intended that a maximum of six suppliers will be appointed to each lot. These will be the Tenderers who meet the minimum total weighting requirements and score the highest based on the Award Criteria. If a number of suppliers score equally and fall into joint sixth place then all tenderers in equal sixth place will be awarded a place on the Framework Agreement.

Lots 1-10 Print Solutions includes, but is not limited to, the following scope; printing, binding, copying, laminating, lithographic printing, digital printing, wide format printing, prospectus printing, leaflets, booklets, business stationery, postcards, booklets, calendars, labels, banners, posters, binders, wallets, folders, finishing. The scope also includes the provision of all elements of design work, web2print functionality and the fulfilment and distribution of the in scope goods. This list is not exhaustive.

Lot 11 Print Management Services – Neutral Vendor includes, to obtain the best value service for members by the appointment and management of suppliers capable of providing the services to meet the following scope; printing, binding, copying, laminating, lithographic printing, digital printing, wide format printing, prospectus printing, leaflets, booklets, business stationery, postcards, booklets, calendars, labels, banners, posters, binders, wallets, folders, finishing. The scope also includes the provision of all elements of design work, web2print functionality and the fulfilment and distribution of the in scope goods. This list is not exhaustive.
